p: Serological analysis demonstrates that evidence of NiV infection is ubiquitous throughout the distribution of flying fox populations in peninsular Malaysia ( figure 4). Overall antibody prevalence in P. vampyrus and P. hypomelanus is 38.7 ( n = 163) and 17.5 per cent ( n = 80), respectively, consistent with previous reports of NiV antibodies or infection in flying fox populations from northern India and throughout southeast Asia [ 12, 27â€“ 29]. Seropositive bats were found at all sampling sites, including the Lenggong colony near the index farm, which had a seroprevalence of 46 per cent ( n = 28, June 2004).
